Class Cell

java.lang.Object
domain.Cell
public class Cell extends Object
Represents a single cell in a game grid. The cell can hold either a plant or a zombie and provides various methods to manage its contents and retrieve information about its state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Cell(int row, int col)
    Initializes a new Cell object with the specified row and column indices.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell(int row, int col)
      Initializes a new Cell object with the specified row and column indices. The cell starts as empty, with no plant or zombie placed in it.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the cell in the game grid.
      col - the column index of the cell in the game grid.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the cell is empty. A cell is considered empty if it contains neither a plant nor a zombie.
      Returns:
      true if the cell has no plant and no zombie, otherwise false.

    • setPlant

      public void setPlant(Plant plant)
      Sets a plant in the cell. This method assigns a specified plant to the cell, replacing any existing plant that may already be present.
      Parameters:
      plant - the plant to be placed in the cell. It can be null to remove any existing plant from the cell.

    • getPlant

      public Plant getPlant()
      Retrieves the plant currently placed in the cell.
      Returns:
      the plant present in the cell, or null if no plant is present.

    • removePlant

      public void removePlant()
      Removes the plant currently placed in the cell. If a plant is present, it is set to null, effectively making the cell empty with respect to plants.

    • setZombie

      public void setZombie(Zombies zombie)
      Sets a zombie in the cell. This method assigns a specified zombie to the cell, replacing any existing zombie that may already be present.
      Parameters:
      zombie - the zombie to be placed in the cell. It can be null to remove any existing zombie from the cell.

    • getZombie

      public Zombies getZombie()
      Retrieves the zombie currently placed in the cell.
      Returns:
      the zombie present in the cell, or null if no zombie is present.

    • removeZombie

      public void removeZombie()
      Removes the zombie from the cell if it is no longer alive. This method checks the zombie's status using the `isAlive` method. If the zombie's hit points are depleted (i.e., it is not alive), it sets the zombie reference in the cell to null, effectively making the cell empty with respect to zombies.

    • hasZombie

      public boolean hasZombie()
      Checks whether the cell contains a zombie. A cell is considered to have a zombie if the `zombie` field is not null.
      Returns:
      true if the cell contains a zombie, false otherwise.

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Retrieves the row index of the cell in the game grid.
      Returns:
      the row index of this cell.

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Retrieves the column index of the cell in the game grid.
      Returns:
      the column index of this cell.

    • hasPlant

      public boolean hasPlant()
      Checks whether the cell contains a plant. A cell is considered to have a plant if the `plant` field is not null.
      Returns:
      true if the cell contains a plant, false otherwise.

    • zombieAtack

      public boolean zombieAtack()
      Determines if a zombie can attack in the current cell. This method checks whether the cell contains both a plant and a zombie, as an attack can only occur under these conditions.
      Returns:
      true if both a plant and a zombie are present in the cell, false otherwise.
